title: AQUA DI PARMA Typeface?
content:
Does anyone recognize the Aqua di Parma typeface/font or know what it might be modified from? It's an Italian fragrance. Thanks!

Here is a link to the company's site: [http://www.acquadiparma.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102931/http:/www.acquadiparma.com/ "http://www.acquadiparma.com")
author: Annie Schultz

comments.content:
Here's a quicker link to the logo image:  
 [http://www.acquadiparma.com/swf/logo\_adp.swf](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102931/http:/www.acquadiparma.com/swf/logo_adp.swf "http://www.acquadiparma.com/swf/logo\_adp.swf")

It's pretty close to Gotham. Just give the P and R larger eyes, drop the middle of the M closer to the baseline, and sharpen the Q.

The 'larger eyes' are also a feature of [House Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20130607102931/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/collections/neutraface). There are alternates for many of the letters, and Neutraface No.2 has more conventional forms, if you need them.

- Mike Yanega
